text:
Hi everyone! I'm testing HubSpot several chatbots in test page.
• Site A: Chatbot A(has a link in script which links to Site B)
• Site B: Chatbot B
• Site C: Chatbot C
but it seems like Chatbot A still shows up even if I was moved to a Site B..
would there be a way to refresh chatbot conversation when I was moved to a new page?

I found this Dev Docs.. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversation/chat-widget-sdk>
would it be work?

Some general HubSpot CMS question. Since HubSpot also have a lot of API’s available and do offer a tracking script, what would be the absolute reason to keep developing inside HubSpot CMS, instead of building something custom with React/NextJS and implement the API’s/tracking from there? Or are some important marketing features not available

every time I am building something I aways evaluate what I’m doing and why.

do I need react to build a simple marketing website? Do we have need to have the ability for marketers to make quick changes to the website to help convert users to help drive business.

All depends on your goals — am I going to use Java to build a todolist just because I need it to be available on lots of devices?

These are questions you have to answer yourself — if you are blindly throwing react at something and then making your marketing team depend on you to make page and website updates — then you’ve solved your job security problem, until they realize that there was a much better way of doing things.

I don’t know what you are trying to build or your goals so I cannot answer your question.

Of course, content marketeers will have access to a custom (headless) CMS. The reason why I would go for something OTHER than HubSpot are:

1. Developer experience
2. Performance
3. More flexibility in terms of functionality 
This will give us the opportunity to create, maintain and use our own component and plugin library.

It is not that I am already sure to switch, but I am looking into all the options and possibilities. So my main question was: will everything be possible with the help of the API’s. So then I am talking about tracking, HubSpot forms and send leads to workflows, campaigns etc etc.

I really don’t know how to answer you — I think you are asking very vague questions.

You can submit to forms via the api.
Having the tracking code implementing correctly will also pick up form fills.

Campaigns are related to page and how you set those up — You’d have to look at how HubSpot events can be sent through the tracking code

I’d go ahead and create a page and throw the tracking code on it and see what it does and how you interact with it and test out your use cases
Is anyone can give me guide link how to show upcoming events only on the event page ? anyone can give me guide is apprepciated thank you :smiling_face_with_3_hearts:

Hi,
is there any way for adding lazy loading in img tag in theme module

can we add height and width attribute in image tag in the theme module,
(is there any other way for solve this so please  tell tell me)
